Member Function Documentation

void lbann::DataReader::calculate_multi_model_data_distribution ( lbann_comm *  comm  )  [inline]

Note that comm->get_model_rank() + comm->get_rank_in_model() is not equivalent to comm->get_world_rank() from a parallel I/O perspective Given the data readers rank, how many readers have a higher rank

Given the data readers rank, how many readers have a lower rank

If this rank is one of the readers, adjust the number of readers to account for that

Compute how big the stride should be assuming that each higher ranked parallel reader has completed a full mini-batch and each lower ranked parallel reader has completed a partial mini-batch

Definition at line 224 of file lbann_data_reader.hpp.

00224                                                                    {
00225       int max_mini_batch_size = BatchSize;
00226       int num_parallel_readers_per_model = (m_stride / comm->get_num_models()) / max_mini_batch_size;
00227 
00228       int num_whole_mini_batches = rint(getNumData() / m_stride);
00229       int partial_mini_batch_size = (getNumData() - (num_whole_mini_batches*m_stride))/(comm->get_num_models() * num_parallel_readers_per_model);
00230       int world_master_remainder_data = 0;
00231 
00232       int world_master_remainder_adjustment = getNumData() 
00233         - (num_whole_mini_batches * m_stride) 
00234         - (partial_mini_batch_size * comm->get_num_models() * num_parallel_readers_per_model);
00235       if(comm->am_world_master()) {
00236         world_master_remainder_data = world_master_remainder_adjustment;
00237         world_master_remainder_adjustment = 0;
00238       }
00239       partial_mini_batch_size += world_master_remainder_data;
00240 
00241       m_last_mini_batch_threshold = m_stride * num_whole_mini_batches;
00242       m_last_mini_batch_size = partial_mini_batch_size;
00243 
00246       int num_readers_at_full_stride = (comm->get_num_models() - comm->get_model_rank()) * num_parallel_readers_per_model;
00248       int num_readers_at_last_stride = comm->get_model_rank() * num_parallel_readers_per_model;
00249       if(comm->get_rank_in_model() < num_parallel_readers_per_model) { 
00250         num_readers_at_full_stride -= comm->get_rank_in_model();
00251         num_readers_at_last_stride += comm->get_rank_in_model();
00252       }
00255       m_last_mini_batch_stride = max_mini_batch_size * num_readers_at_full_stride
00256         + (partial_mini_batch_size * (num_readers_at_last_stride)) + world_master_remainder_adjustment;
00257 
00258       //      cout << "[" << comm->get_rank_in_world() << "] " << comm->get_model_rank() << " model rank, num_whole_mini_batches=" << num_whole_mini_batches << " partial_mini_batch_size=" << partial_mini_batch_size << " world_master_remainder_data=" << world_master_remainder_data << " threshold " << m_last_mini_batch_threshold << " with a last stride of " << m_last_mini_batch_stride << " and stride of " << m_stride << " and there are " << num_parallel_readers_per_model << " parallel readers per model " <<endl;
00259 
00260       return;
00261     }

void lbann::DataReader::select_subset_of_data ( size_t  max_sample_count,
bool  firstN 
) [inline]

If the user requested fewer than the total data set size, select a random set from the entire data set.

void lbann::DataReader::setup ( int  base_offset,
int  stride,
int  model_offset = 0,
lbann_comm *  comm = NULL 
) [inline]

Prepare to start processing an epoch of data. If shuffle is true, then shuffle the indices of the data set If the base offset is not specified set it to 0 If the stride is not specified set it to batch size

Definition at line 75 of file lbann_data_reader.hpp.

00081         calculate_multi_model_data_distribution(comm);
00082         m_use_alt_last_mini_batch_size = true;
00083       }
00084 
00085       CurrentPos = m_base_offset + m_model_offset;
00086       if (m_shuffle) {
00087         std::shuffle(ShuffledIndices.begin(), ShuffledIndices.end(),
00088                      get_generator());
00089       }
00090     }

virtual bool lbann::DataReader::update (  )  [inline, virtual]

During the network's update phase, the data reader will advanced the current position pointer. If the pointer wraps around, then reshuffle the data indicies.

Definition at line 115 of file lbann_data_reader.hpp.

00115                           {
00116       if(m_use_alt_last_mini_batch_size && CurrentPos+m_stride > m_last_mini_batch_threshold) {
00117         CurrentPos += m_last_mini_batch_stride;
00118       }else {
00119         CurrentPos += m_stride;
00120       }
00121       if (CurrentPos < (int)ShuffledIndices.size()) {
00122         return true;
00123       } else {
00124         if (m_shuffle) {
00125           std::shuffle(ShuffledIndices.begin(), ShuffledIndices.end(),
00126                        get_generator());
00127         }
00128         CurrentPos = m_base_offset + m_model_offset;
00129         return false;
00130       }
00131     }

bool lbann::DataReader::m_use_alt_last_mini_batch_size [protected]

Provide a set of size, strides, and thresholds to handle the last mini batch of a dataset.

If there are multiple models with multiple instances of the reader, each model's set of readers may not reset to zero
